graphlocalalignment

Interface IGraphLocalAlignment

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphLocalAlignment

    public interface IGraphLocalAlignment
    The package is an interface to compare two graphs locally. The assumptions of input graphs are,
    • every node is distinct;
    • and, no multiple edges between any pair of nodes.
    • Simple Graphs are preferred.

    The package will generate new adjacency matrix (Intersection based, only including the same nodes shared by two graphs)

    In order to considering the case of possible missing edges, some degrees of transitivity are allowed when comparing two graphs.

    Note, the input usually includes two graphs in adjacency matrix format and related nodes array. The nodes array is an array of string (containing the primary key of each node) with the same order with the adjacent matrices. The penalty system is optional.
